TopicTitle: Ship parts fall off when reaching orbit

Articles.Content:
Version: 0.90.0.705 Steam

OS: Windows 7 64 bit

Mods: All Stock

I've been unsuccessful in replicating while running video, but it's as advertised really. My craft hits the edge of the atmosphere and... all the parts fall off. The crew module keeps its momentum, but all other parts disconnect from each other and drop straight back to Kerbin.

Intel Core i7-2700K CPU @ 3.50GHz

NVIDIA GeForce GTX 570

8.00 GB RAM
Strange.... I think extreme G-force can do this but in excess of 30g. You wouldn't happen to have a seriously high thrust to weight ratio?
No but I have a new symptom. I decoupled my engined just now, yet I am still accelerating. I will make a new thread for this, it may well be unrelated.

Pictures of the craft and possibly some log files would help. What does it say in the F3 flight log?

Cheers,

-Claw

A picture of the craft would be redundant. It's just the pod doing bugger all. It's easier to say that I cannot rotate the craft, and increasing the thrust does nothing to change my velocity or acceleration. The flight log says nothing other than the seperation sequence (and a bit of damage when I decoupled some radial boosters ).

Well, the infinite acceleration could be a result of part clipping, but I can't tell that because there is no picture. Also, a picture of the craft before the problem could be helpful in recreating the problem. I agree that a picture of an Mk1 pod isn't very useful, but I'm asking for the a pic of the ship right before it experiences the problem. Perhaps even post the .craft file.

If all we have to go on is "I can make a ship where all the pieces fall off," it's hard to offer specific advice.

Cheers,

-Claw
